hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Remove "" from input variables if present VAPP_NAME=`sed -e 's/^"//' -e 's/"$//' <<< $VAPP_NAME` VM_NAME=`sed -e 's/^"//' -e 's/"$//' <<< $VM_NAME`
if [ ${#VAPP_NAME} -lt 1 ] || [ ${#VM_NAME} -lt 1 ] then echo Invalid input parameters return -1 fi
echo VAPP_NAME=${VAPP_NAME} VM_NAME=${VM_NAME}
# Quick check for existing server
if [[ $(ping -c 1 ${VM_NAME}) && $? -eq 0 ]]; then echo "Found Existing Server ${VM_NAME}!" exit 0 fi
# Login using vca-cli vca login --password $VCA_PASSWORD --save-password --host vchs.vmware.com --type subscription --version 5.6 --org M933009684-4424 vcadevops@gmail.com
vca vdc use --vdc M933009684-4424
export IP=`vca vm -a $VAPP_NAME | grep $VM_NAME | cut -d '|' -f5 | tr -d '[[:space:]]'` && echo $IP
# Create new VM and Unbuntu Server # if vapp exists skip echo "Check for existing Vapp with same name" if [ ${#IP} -lt 1 ] then
echo "Create VApp" vca vapp create -a $VAPP_NAME -V $VM_NAME -c 'Public Catalog' -t 'Ubuntu Server 12.04 LTS (amd64 20150127)' -n M933009684-4424-default-routed -m DHCP
echo "Customize Vapp" vca vapp customize --vapp $VAPP_NAME --vm $VM_NAME --file ~/add_public_ssh_key.sh
# get the new vm ip echo "Wait for Boot" IP=`/home/ubuntu/vcadevops/scenarios/jenkins/wait_boot_ip.sh $VAPP_NAME $VM_NAME`
fi
id
# Set Host Name echo "Set Host Name" /home/ubuntu/vcadevops/scenarios/jenkins/set_host_name.sh $IP precise-amd64 $VM_NAME
# Add host entry echo "Register hostname" sudo /home/ubuntu/vcadevops/scenarios/jenkins/add_host_entry.sh ${IP} ${VM_NAME}
